summary: This bill, the Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act, amends existing federal laws—primarily the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 (ADEA), Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA), and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973—to clarify standards for proving employment discrimination and retaliation claims.  It establishes a "motivating factor" standard, allowing plaintiffs to prevail if discrimination was a motivating factor, even if other factors were involved. It also details permissible remedies and extends these protections to federal employees. The bill applies to pending and future claims and includes a severability clause.
